definition: to walk slowly up a flight of steps (idiom)
to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: You can take the stairs or the lift up.
sentences.chinese: 你可以拾級而上或是乘坐電梯。

sentences.english: As soon as they'd pulled up, he'd leaped out of the taxi and ascended the steps past the doorman.
sentences.chinese: 因此車子一停，他就大步跨出來，經過門衛拾級而上。

sentences.english: Why I have spent half my life ascending upward.
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼我花了大半輩子拾級而上。

sentences.english: The a - ma temple was built by the cliff . there are winding paths around upwards the hill.
sentences.chinese: 媽閣廟依崖而建，沿山麓迂迴小徑，拾級而上。

sentences.english: We turn and begin the slow climb up. The old log stairs.
sentences.chinese: 我們轉身，沿着陳舊的木臺階慢慢地拾級而上。
